text: Love is not measured by how long you hold hands, but by how tightly you hold hearts.
author: Paul

text: True love does not demand perfection; it celebrates flaws as proof of humanity.
author: Paul

text: Every heartbeat is a reminder that love was written into us before we spoke our first word.
author: Paul

text: Love grows not in grand gestures, but in the quiet moments that no one else sees.
author: Paul

text: To love is to give freedom without fear of losing, and to receive without chains of control.
author: Paul

text: A single glance from the right soul can echo louder than a thousand words.
author: Paul

text: Love is the only fire that warms without burning and heals without leaving scars.
author: Paul

text: The beauty of love is not found in what it takes, but in how much it gives without asking.
author: Paul

text: Love whispers in the spaces between words, where silence carries its deepest truth.
author: Paul

text: Every soul longs for love, but only the brave dare to give it first.
author: Paul

text: Real love doesn’t fade with time; it deepens, like roots gripping the earth.
author: Paul

text: Love is not blind—it sees clearly, yet chooses to stay anyway.
author: Paul

text: In the arms of love, even the weakest heart feels unbreakable.
author: Paul

text: The simplest touch from the right person can quiet storms within you.
author: Paul

text: Love is the art of seeing eternity in a fleeting moment.
author: Paul
